Less than daily reminder that League is a team game, so some form of communication must be available. There is no realistic system where Pings could be muteable, that wouldn't lead to negative results.

If a player is just constantly spam pinging, they aren't using it for anything useful anyways.

I'd rather outright ignore them so I can focus on the other members of my team.
this
I'm not talking about cases were pings are used incorrectly. I'm referring to the cases of people muting pings they disagree with, people muting everyone, a four muting the remaining player, etc.

You're right in that this is a team game; however, in solo queue - there's bound to be a game or two (or even more) in which even one specific teammate will go out of their way to spam ping another's mistake and can even go to the point of even harassing the player non-verbally by doing this. 

/Mute all already exists to filter out the chat from unneeded flame or for those players who would rather focus on their gameplay as opposed to hear banter that more than likely to help less than useful/smart pings. However, as others have mentioned - a way to mute pings from specific players within a game can help deal with those that abuse the system as opposed to using pings correctly to help support the team game.

Are ping spams game-breaking? Not necessarily for all; however, it's a quality of life change that can help those affected by such situations.
